remarks: Heine-Cantor theorem: a continuous mapping between metric spaces whose domain is compact is uniformly continuous.  Theorem on [Rosenlicht] p. 80.  (Contributed by Brendan Leahy, 13-Aug-2018.)
statement:
heicant.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( *Met ` X ) ) $.
heicant.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( *Met ` Y ) ) $.
heicant.j $e |- ( ph -> ( MetOpen ` C ) e. Comp ) $.
heicant.x $e |- ( ph -> X =/= (/) ) $.
heicant.y $e |- ( ph -> Y =/= (/) ) $.
heicant $p |- ( ph -> ( ( metUnif ` C ) uCn ( metUnif ` D ) ) = ( ( MetOpen ` C ) Cn ( MetOpen ` D ) ) ) $.
